intro: Elaphoglossum commissurale, commonly known as the narrow-leaf holly fern, is a member of the Dryopteridaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial fern characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds in clusters called sori. Elaphoglossum commissurale is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental foliage.
